1.content:
Family attic's always have a way of storing treasures. Whether the be pictures, family heirlooms, or fads of times forgotten (looking at you, Furbee), there was always something of interest to be found. The Handbasquette household was no different. After 28 years of marriage, Bruce and Helena had acquired a number of goods that time had forgotten. There was your regular assortment of cheerleading outfits from the girls' younger days, old musical instruments from passions lost, and old-timey steamer trunks full of items inherited from other family members.

Knowing this, Jeremy decided to take a peek upstairs to see if he could find anything of interest. It was going to be a long summer, and he figured he might as well try to dig up something interesting.

"It's so damn hot up here," Jeremy said under his breath as he wiped the sweat from his brow. Three weeks into summer vacation, he had beat all of the video games he owned and was now looking for some new adventure.

"Weird," he said as he tossed aside an old cowbell. Same with a pair of roller skates, and even a strange looking medallion with two varying shapes on each side. "Who would ever want that," he thought.

That's when it caught his eye. The book was bound in leather, with gold calligraphy on the binding. It seemed to almost call for him. Much like a moth attracted to the glimmer of a lightbulb in summer, Jeremy couldn't help but approach the strange, timeless text. Dusting off the adjacent trunk, he grabbed the book and placed it on his lap to peruse.

"What are you," he murmured, wanting to investigate more. As he opened the pages, he found several different headings.

info.brief_description: Bored during vacation, Jeremy is in his attic when he stumbles across a strange text.
info.description:
During summer vacation, Jeremy Handbasquette is fiddling around the attic at this parent's house. There's the usual old clothing, used furniture, as well as some steamer trunks full of this and that. While perusing these lost relics, he comes across a leather-bound book that practically calls his name. When he opens it, he's confounded by the origins of this text. Why would it be in this attic? Where did his parents get such a book? What was the purpose of this text?

Characters

Jeremy - A 16-year old boy on summer vacation. Jeremy loves his video games, hanging with his friends, and lives a pretty good life. He's 5'10" and weighs about 150lbs. He's always had a penchant for fantasy novels, but is largely grounded in reality, always the skeptic of claims of magic and the such.
Jennifer - Jeremy's 19-year old sister. She's home from her first year of college, being paid for by her water polo scholarship. Jennifer is athletic, enthusiastic, and loves to party. At 5'7" and 140lbs, Jennifer is mostly muscle and takes remarkable shape of herself.
Tiffany - Jeremy's 24-year old sister. Having taken a job at the local school district, Tiffany sees her little brother regularly during the school year. Since she lives so close, she frequents the family's home. Tiffany is more of a homebody, and stands a mere 5'4", but lack of regular exercise has left her a stout 160lbs.
Helena - The matriarch of the of the Handbasquette family. She's happy her family has grown and is learning independence, as she likes to spend time with other mothers in the neighborhood. At 5'6" and 160lbs, her mature stature states plainly that she has been a mother for quite some time.
Bruce - The man of the house has been working as an engineer for quite some time. He's a loving father and budding scientist in his spare time. He tinkers around the garage, but loves nothing more than a good family outing.
